title: Do you know how to write? - Quora

response.answer_text: All I know about writing is, writing can be emotional Writing can be therapeutic, writing can open up a persons imagination and take them from reality into a fantasy world in which the writer has crated in their mind whether it be on an epic adventure battling orcs hunting witches, being chased by a rabid rogue Bear or better yet what about a rogue Deer? or Rabbit? or perhaps on the high season a battleship defending off kamikaze warplanes! Writing is where I find that the right type of words can really grab the writer attention I strongly believe that the right type of words or writing it should flow, or have flow a person should be able to visualize without struggle a sheep in the pasture sure it works fine, but What about A blood thirsty coyote stealthily watches the sheep as it lazily grazes unaware of it natural habitat uncaring of what watches a few meters away…. another thing about writing is punctuation and spelling nothing can hurt a person more then checking basic grammar and spelling commas and periods. where the should be and capitalization when to capitalize for example bridge is bridge but The Brooklyn Bridge well that is all I know about writing ha ha and writing is art!

This question is tricky. The reason is simple. There is specification as to what type of writing we're talking about here. Because I know that even a baby can write. Illiterate people can write. And so on. But to be more specific, yes, I can write. As a lawyer I've had to churn out countless pages of work. Further, as a freelance writer, I've had to work on business articles, fiction, alongside other type of writing for clients. So, yes, I can write. Kingsley Ugochukwu Ani L.P. is my legal blog where legal samples of my article can be found.

Yes. Y-E-S. If I know how to type, you can also assume I can write since I would have to be rather familiar with the alphabet and what it means in order to tap the right letters on my keyboard. So you know how to write, too! Congrats.

This is like asking “do you know how to play tennis?” I’ve been writing for 35 years. I have written four books and over a million words of blog posts, including a book on writing. And I’m still learning. Everyone can write. The question is, can you write better than you do now?

Apparently. I can put letters down on paper & screen; form coherent sentences, paragraphs, and documents of various lengths. I seem to do it well enough, in other people’s eyes, to get two books published (along with some sales), win a bunch of proposals, get some conference papers accepted & published, write a column for a while.

Well, if we talking about novels, then I can. I have a passion for making good stories, and and write them down, but the real challenge about it is the vocabulary, which gives me a hard time at some part. But the end always turn out well.
No, you just think you're seeing this message.
